threads.text: No lag, no heating up.
fastest phone I've ever owned.
FAst in general terms, but enabling the "resising screen" option slow downs a lot the GUI.
Not the fastest phone I ever seen

But fast enough for many if not all things. Totally foobar to have every 6 to 12 month a new Phone.

I'm happy with the Moto Z in all manner.

I've compared benchmarks and noticed that my Moto Z (Brazilian Edition)  has a lower hardware (CPU) than others. Brazilian version of moto z is "cropped" compared to moto z usa, for example. I'm so sad. I don't feel it is fast as expected and my biggest frustation is the smothless. See my benchmark results:


Does anyone know how to make this moto z faster and smooth?

replies.text: Our Z has 1.8giga max speed compared to the US droid that sports default and higher (2.2 giga I presume) max. It is because of the battery. But if you put on some custom kernel you can gain those max clock values. Just tell me why do you need this. Mine blazing fast. Data, response, multitasking... Not a single lag since the day one. SOT is a bit decent though. Can get around 5 hrs of usage, not playing games. And that is just fine when bearing in mind the battery being of 2600 mah. Do not take these syntetic benchmark so closely. Or you'd be sleeping well enough when having better score? I came from my beloved Nexus 5x and this phone outperforms it in some ways. Getting this phone for 240 usd on a special one-off event made me jump into the lake and enjoy the show.

threads.text: I'm not caring about benchmark tests at all. Sometimes I got lagging and heating up with some regular use, not gaming. I'm using it with INCIPIO battery mod trying to reach end of day without plug it to an outlet. Shoud I take it to a custom rom?
my devices has some real problems with gps apps. 3-4hours drive it will just make all apps stuck. i expected more from this phone...

if we're talking benchmarks im sure there are plenty of phones that can surpass it HOWEVER if we are talking overall speed and responsiveness it surpasses all the recent phones i owned 
(LG V20,NOKIA 8,PIXEL,HTC 10,HTC U ULTRA,Iphone 8 plus,iphone 7 plus,lg g6,galaxy s8,huawei p10,note FE and many more)
This is ok,right?
This is a good result.
Fast but feel it like being throttled
opened in a buzz fast
Launches most apps really fast, but some are a little slow.
Pretty well in multi tasking even while im copying large files, didn't even fell any delay on screen and on other apps.

Surprisingly well-managed RAM management.

Still tends to kick apps a bit too early at times, but for the most part, it manages its available RAM well, even keeping an app that's been opened hours ago running in the background without killing it from memory, like my iPad Pro.
Smooth as butter

The thinness of the phone works against it.
Its gets a bit warm in normal use but not too much.
During charging it can quickly heat up esp. in summers.
A style shell or case somewhat helps.

Mine is going sometimes to 45 C. It's unpleasant to hold.
I flashed Stock 7.1.1 ROM yesterday. After that it doesnt get so extremly warm, as with Custom ROM.

Low-light performance is decent.

On the standard model with the 1/3" 13MP Sony Exmor IMX214, it has its limits, which seem to be tighter than phones like the Samsung Galaxy S7 and Google Pixel XL, but the wider f/1.8 aperture does help with letting more light in and OIS seems to be robust enough to handle handshakes until around a shutter speed of 1/8.

Photos tend to expose much brighter than they need to, which results in a bit more noise, so dialing it in with the exposure slider is recommended. The standard camera app includes a night mode that's enabled automatically based on conditions and overall, works quite well.

Overall, photos come out reasonably well, although exposure can sometimes land a bit too high, resulting in a bit more noise when left on its own. Photos also tend to have quite a bit of ISO noise but photo quality is overall quite solid, although it does require some user involvement.

The Moto Z performs quite decently in low-light and can even provide some nice shots with some coaxing and a steady hand, although options like the Google Pixel and the S7 may provide better overall performance. The larger 1/2.4" 21MP Sony IMX338 on the Z Force Droid Edition does provide better performance.

Low light it works okay, but to little little it does come out bad. I read in another place they recommend using HDR. I tend to leave it on and it has improved a lot of my low light pictures but most the time I turn on professional mode and mess with it. Seems like a hassle when inside a dark area like bar/club or indoors. Most are use to point and shooting a picture that messing with the controls feels like a hassle, but eventually you find a setting that works in that atmosphere and just go back to it.
Not a very good low light camera. HDR helps though.

replies.text: The Moto Z does not support Quick Charge 3.0.  It does, however, support the Type-C/USB-PD first level power rule, which gives you 15W: https://forum.xda-developers.com/sho...28&postcount=9

The Moto Z also happens to be incredibly thin – allegedly the thinnest smartphone ever – but that comes with both a caveat, and some serious shortcomings when it comes to battery life. In the famous words of Jeff Goldblum, "Motorola was so preoccupied with whether or not they could, they didn’t stop to think if they should". At least that’s how I think the quote went.

threads.text: Actually amazed at this. For a small battery I get great SOT. My best is 7h 46m, worst is 5h 15m, and I usually get about 6h SOT.

replies.text: With the Incipio Mod, right? If else I'm assuming you're constantly on wifi. But it is an amazing SOT, considering the small battery. I come from a Moto Z Play and I thought I would miss it more in terms of battery life... But this little dude gives me around 5-6 of SOT with the battery mod, in 4G all the time. I do miss that if I fell asleep, when I woken up I didn't have to charge the phone, but I can live with it. Awesome battery life.

threads.text: how do you manage that i can't get 3h sot with moderate use, some text messages, 2 YT videos and maybe some IG browsing

I have the phone for half a year now and I barely get 2 1/2 hour screen on time with a fully charged phone. In day-to-day use this means the battery is half dead after 6 hours even though I've actively used the phone only for about half an hour.

I'm a moderate user but this phone does NOT give you a full day of runtime. I'm using stock ROM at the moment with only a hand full of apps. The battery life so abysmal that I'll switch to another phone soon.

[EDIT] I've kept the phone away from the charger at work today just to get you guys an example. I used the phone for 40 minutes overall and the battery reached 5% after 10 hours. Then I charged it up to 50% and it still did not last the rest of the day.

replies.text:
same here. barely 2h of screen on time with 10h from 100%-0%. only very moderate use. almost all apps restricted from background data use. that is just simply poor battery life. 
i'll make use of warranty because there some several other problems ( overheating with gps apps; only partically working fingerprintsensor; stocking media playback; etc)

threads.text: I got much worse screen time with Oreo update. Did a full reset but still seeing the same numbers. Using AccuBattery and it shows 1% battery for about 1-2 minutes of screen time.
Pretty good
Lost 3% on standby during 8 hours through the night.
Now that I'm on nougat, I'm losing about 8% over a 7 hour period

Not all cores stay in deep sleep when the screen is off.
I am seeing about 50% at 652MHz and 50% Deep Sleep when the screen off. I am not sure if this is expected.

I am also losing about 1% / hour in standby with the latest Nougat Update.
I just got it so I can't compare before & after.

1 percent per hour can be completely normal depending on someone's setup, apps install, signal strength, etc.  

Most phones I've ever owned are about that or just under.  Only my Nexus 7 2012 was way lower.  About 0.4% per hour.  

1 percent per hour is definitely not anything to be too concerned with honestly.

I'd start with CPU spy or a similar app, to see if your phone is actually in deep sleep when not used.  If not, then you could have an issue.

i am extremely satisfied with stock(everything stock unrooted,locked bl) standby drain. I don't use Approach, Attentive Display and Notification Display in Moto app.

Wifi ON : 3% over 7 hours sleep
Wifi OFF : 1% over 6 hours sleep
Data(3G) ON : 7% over 5 hours sleep

Since N7 update, getting very bad idle drain.
Losing 28% during 7 Hrs overnight (>4%/Hr) and the BBS logs don't show any major issues.
Posting my logs here hoping a fresh pair of eyes can locate any anomalies I missed.

You might have bad reception in the place you have your phone. Check settings>battery> click on graph>cellular network signal. If the bar is red/ orange or has many small red lines you might be located between two towers. 

Try switching to 3G or 2G overnight and if there is a dramatic difference it will confirm its signal-related battery drain.

replies.text:
Just an update; I used a Tasker profile to disable WiFi and Bluetooth when Display is off between 11 PM to 6 AM (my approx. sleep window). This has brought down the Idle consumption during night to 0.8%/Hr suggesting at-least one of them to be the reason for abnormal drain. I think the WiFi or Bluetooth modules in the Nougat update may not be fully optimised. I intend to test with only one of them turned OFF alternatively over next two nights and locate the real culprit.
Of course this does not help me during the day when both WiFi and Bluetooth have to be kept ON as I can't be bothered to turn them On/Off frequently whenever I start/stop listening to music or connect/disconnect to work WiFi.  I'll explore if I can write Tasker profiles to switch them On/Off based on location, proximity to work WiFi AP and music steaming status.

Also, as suggested by @Vcek above, I can see some orange bars in the battery graph overnight indicating signal issues at my home location which may also be adding to the increased drain.
Overall I am sufficiently comfortable now knowing what is causing the increased drain and having at least some level of control over it.

threads.text:
So I've had the phone for just about 2 weeks now, the battery doesn't seem to take too kindly to heavy use, but does make it through the day no problem. I usually fully charge the phone before leaving for work in the morning, then throughout the day I will listen to audiobooks, take calls, stream from spotify and play games occasionally. So I would say I use it pretty intensively during the work week and it hasn't let me down yet.

This is on stock, running full brightness without and battery saving app running.
As long as it won't explode...I would use it as long as I want.
As good looking as any 2016 flagship phone, but the bezels could be put to better use.

Quality of power key is really s**s 
After 2 month of using this phone 
Every time I press or holding power key it feels like this is the last time I can press it to get response 

Also I think volume keys have same quality

threads.text:
Phone is made of Aluminium if i'm not wrong. And Aluminium is not as  Scratch resistent as Glas on the back. But it is more flexible and doesnt break.

I like the Aluminium more then Glas, and the Buildquality is because of that much better.

Bendtest on YT said : It is much more stable then Glas (including Gorilla) on the back, and the Border does not brake (At the Power/Volume Buttons) like other Phones.
Great, close to stock. Still lacking in features compared to most other OEMs and updates are very few and far between. Still on a july security patch.

Probably the dumbest part of the skin is that you can't set the homescreen to the middle. No, the damned thing has to be on the most LEFT panel. What are you? An iPhone? Half the reason I bought an android was to set the homescreen to the center.

replies.text: It uses the Google Now Launcher, which as the name implies keeps Google Now easily accessible with a single swipe from the homescreen. You can always install Nova launcher or another customizable google now-esque launcher and have the home screens setup like you want (which nova does by default)

threads.text: Put it on vibrant setting better than my s7edge cause sunlight viewing is better than s7edge and nexus 6p
Enough to use,right? At least you can post threads with it

I walk every morning at a state park that is right on the shore of lake erie and this Moto z is the first phone to not drop signal. (Verizon) All of my previous phones would usually show 3 signal bars at home, the moto z has 4. Went from the usual 103 dbm to 99 with the Z. Very happy with the cell reception. Wi-Fi seems pretty much the same. I might be able to get an additional 10 feet further with the Z before dropping a signal. The radios in this thing are excellent. For reference I have had HTC 8,  LG G3, LG G4, GS3, GS5, GS7 edge, Note 3 and Note 5, Moto x 2014 and Moto x PE. I usually don't keep a phone for more than 6 months.

Coming from the MXPE (moto x pure edition) there is no comparison. Speakerphone and all audio volumes are extremely low in volume. Need to have the phone on vibrate or I will miss calls and texts as that volume is also 1/4 the volume of the MXPE. I realize that the MXPE is not a fair comparison because of the stereo speakers and thickness of the phone, but the difference is enough that I am considering returning the phone. GPS nav useless, speakerphone useless, watching videos sucks  unless you want to hold the phone 2 " from your ears. YMMV   Just my experience with the phone and it sucks because otherwise even unrooted the phone operates as a beast.
EDIT update: I must have a defective JBL mod. In the phone settings there is  a way to reset the mod, and when I reset it the speaker phone and GPS nav both have tremendous volume. Only problem is sound goes off randomly and I have to keep resetting the JBL mod for it to work properly. Will take it back and report back if that was the problem.
they keep the speaker low so you will buy the mods ^^.  missed call all the time on my z force

replies.text:

That thing attached to the phone also makes it a real brick to carry around in a pocket, you better be wearing a belt ! 
Hoping like heck this thing gets rooted so I can play around with the sound files. Other wise it may be Hasta la vista for this phone.

threads.text: I have an Indian version... It's speaker is also pathetically low!

Coming from a droid maxx XT1080M, this device loudspeaker is awful. Although it has front facing speakers but watching youtube videos result in very low audio loudness. The droid maxx is almost identical to the Nexus 6P in terms of loudness, whereas the Moto Z is just marginally better than the iPhone 6S.

If you trawl through the 49+ pages of annoyed (soon to be ex-moto owners) in the official Lenovo forum 

https://forums.lenovo.com/t5/Moto-Z-...420410/page/49 

then there is a dude who contacted one of Moto's senior execs (Brazil) ... and their response was that this was introduced to prevent damaging some poor sods ears that had their lug next to the phone when a notification arrived (coz it's only got one speaker)

As such. this is a design feature that MOTO don't seem to highlight very much....INVISIBLE NOTIFICATIONS.... yes. it's the new craze !!! Strange that they don't showcase this a bit more !!!

So, if you think there will be a fix soon... forget it... it's a 49+ page thread on  lenovorola's OWN forum and hee-haw has been done about it.

Rant over.
